title: Mikis Theodorakis - Canto General (Live)(Greek Music)@320
description:
Canto General 


Pablo Neruda&#039;s tenth book of poems. It was first published in Mexico in 1950, by Talleres GrÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â¡ficos de la NaciÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â³n. Neruda began to compose it in 1938.

"Canto General" consists of 15 sections, 231 poems, and more than 15,000 lines. This work attempts to be a history or encyclopedia of the whole continent of Hispanic America.


The "Canto General" was intoned by several musicians. The best known intonation is by Mikis Theodorakis, a leftist composer and politician from Greece; the vocals in the original recording are by Maria Farantouri and Petros Pandis, who both sang in Spanish language.
